instruction: How effective was the proposed SINB method, which combines spectral indexes and Naive Bayes, in distinguishing heavy metal pollution in crops using hyperspectral remote sensing?
Output: The proposed SINB method, which combines spectral indexes and Naive Bayes, was highly effective in distinguishing heavy metal pollution in crops using hyperspectral remote sensing. The method achieved a discrimination accuracy of 100% in both the training group and the validation group. The CLPIOR, CLPICR, and CLPIFOD spectral indexes were found to be sensitive in distinguishing Copper (Cu) and Lead (Pb) pollution. This method utilized the crop leaf spectral characteristics and the advantages of machine learning to successfully discriminate crop heavy metal pollution.
